meanings.definition: To dig or scoop out material from a solid mass.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist will excavate the ancient artifacts carefully.
meanings.sent2: The construction crew will excavate the foundation for the new building.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to excavate for buried treasure in the sandbox.
meanings.sent4: Her memories seemed to excavate deep emotions she had long buried.
meanings.sent5: The machine roared to life, ready to excavate the rocky terrain.

meanings.definition: To uncover or expose by digging.
meanings.sent1: The team will excavate the buried ruins to reveal the ancient city.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologists will excavate the fossil carefully to preserve it.
meanings.sent3: The dog tried to excavate the buried bone in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: Her questions seemed to excavate hidden truths about the situation.
meanings.sent5: The light of dawn began to excavate the darkness of the night sky.

meanings.definition: To make a hole or channel by digging.
meanings.sent1: The workers will excavate a trench for the new pipeline.
meanings.sent2: The ants excavate tunnels in the ground for their colony.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to excavate a well in the flour to pour the liquid.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to excavate a path through her doubts.
meanings.sent5: The river had excavated a deep canyon over centuries of flowing water.
